channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Apple's HomePod mini apparently has an inactive temperature and humidity sensor
item.description: iFixit found the sensor hidden away from the mini's other internal components.

item.title: William Basinski looks back on ‘Disintegration Loops’ and dying media
item.description: A new documentary at SXSW explores the composer's serendipitous ode to uncertainty.

item.title: Preservation effort unearths over 750 PlayStation 2 game prototypes
item.description: A preservation group has obtained over 750 PlayStation 2 game prototypes and demos, including 'God of War.'

item.title: ‘The Falcon and the Winter Soldier’ is the show MCU diehards have been waiting for
item.description: 'The Falcon and the Winter Soldier' is our first real look at a post-Blip world.

item.title: Spotify's new home screen lets you quickly resume unfinished podcasts
item.description: About a year ago, Spotify revamped its home screen to make it easier to find your favorite playlists and podcasts. It was a pretty helpful redesign, and today Spotify announced that it's further tweaking things with a focus on quickly getting back to what you've been listening to.

item.title: Sony's 360 Reality Audio speakers are now available for pre-order
item.description: Sony's first 360 Reality Audio speakers are now available for pre-order, priced at $300 and $700.

item.title: 'Resident Evil Village' is coming to Stadia on May 7th
item.description: If you pre-order or buy the game by May 21st, you'll get a free Stadia Controller and Chromecast Ultra.

item.title: Get this Klipsch home theater surround sound system for over 50 percent off
item.description: This complete surround sound set by Klipsch will help fill the gaps that your TV is missing.

item.title: Samsung reveals pricing for its latest Q-series and A-series soundbars
item.description: The HW-Q800A, which offers built-in Alexa voice control and Dolby Atmos support, costs $900.

item.title: Roku will stream every episode of 'This Old House' for free
item.description: Roku now owns every last bit of 'This Old House,' and it's streaming all episodes for free through the Roku Channel.

item.title: Hard drives are about to get supercharged
item.description: HAMR and MAMR are a pair of new methods for writing data to hard drives that could boost capacity as high as 60TB per drive, or beyond.

item.title: FDA clears first AI device to spot hidden signs of COVID-19
item.description: The FDA has cleared an AI-powered armband for emergency use that can identify signs of COVID-19 in asymptomatic individuals using light sensors and a computer processor.

item.title: Samsung's Galaxy S21 Ultra drops to a new low price of $900
item.description: The Galaxy S21 Ultra is on sale for a new low price of $900 at Samsung thanks to an offer code.

item.title: Google's Pixel Buds drop to $159 at B&H Photo and Best Buy
item.description: Google's Pixel Buds are on sale for $159 at Best Buy and B&H Photo -- that's $20 less than their normal price.

item.title: Fitbit's Inspire 2 wearable gains Tile's tracking tech
item.description: Fitbit is adding support for Tile's Bluetooth item tracking tech to its Inspire 2 wearable by way of a free update.

item.title: Jeep's all-electric Wrangler concept has a six-speed manual transmission
item.description: Jeep aims to show that EVs can be more than just staid sedans with a new concept based on its classic Wrangler 4x4.

item.title: HP’s new Envy laptops feature larger, 4K displays
item.description: HP is launching two new Envy laptops with new Intel and AMD processors, NVIDIA graphics and up to 4K OLED resolution.

item.title: The Morning After: Brazil wants in-box chargers with new iPhones
item.description: Apple is fined in Brazil for selling iPhones without a charger, while Coinbase is fined $6.5 million over cryptocurrency trading claims. Also: Donald Trump is planning his very own social network.

item.title: Apple pulls more iMac models ahead of possible M1 refresh
item.description: Apple has stopped selling two versions of the 21.5 inch iMac amid rumors that it's planning a new all-in-one workstation.

item.title: Samsung latest high-res monitors go all-in on HDR
item.description: Samsung has launched its business and consumer lineup of high-resolution monitors, and this year, all 12 of them support HDR.

item.title: Dyson's new air purifier shows how much formaldehyde it's trying to destroy
item.description: The new Dyson Purifier Formaldehyde air purifiers — Hot+Cool (HP09) and Cool (TP09) — are able to distinguish formaldehyde from other VOCs using a dedicated solid-state formaldehyde sensor, in order to better monitor the carcinogenic gas constantly released from the likes of furniture, carpets, paint and flooring.

item.title: Opera's iOS app gets a cleaner look and shorter name
item.description: The app's no longer called Opera Touch.

item.title: TikTok bans some Myanmar accounts to limit the reach of violent videos
item.description: TikTok is banning accounts from Myanmar that post violent videos, but it comes long after other sites took action.

item.title: Donald Trump plans to launch a social network in 'two to three months'
item.description: A Donald Trump aide says the former President will launch a social network in two to three months, although it may have trouble getting the tech partners it needs.

item.title: Apple to pay $308.5 million for allegedly violating a DRM patent
item.description: Apple has been ordered to pay $308.5 million in a lawsuit alleging that the copyright protection in the App Store and Music violates PMC's patents.
